trans-unit.source: Code Sample: ASP.NET Web Service
trans-unit.target: Code Sample: ASP.NET Web Service

trans-unit.source: Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure

trans-unit.source: Code Sample: ASP.NET Web Service
trans-unit.target: Code Sample: ASP.NET Web Service

trans-unit.source: This samples illustrates how to integrate <token>firstref_acs</token> into a simple web service.
trans-unit.target: This samples illustrates how to integrate <token>firstref_acs</token> into a simple web service.

trans-unit.source: It uses ASP.NET as a web service host and a command line client.
trans-unit.target: It uses ASP.NET as a web service host and a command line client.

trans-unit.source: The ASP.NET web service requires a SWT token issued by <token>secondref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: The ASP.NET web service requires a SWT token issued by <token>secondref_acs</token>.

trans-unit.source: The client requests a token from <token>secondref_acs</token> with a user name and password registered with <token>secondref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: The client requests a token from <token>secondref_acs</token> with a user name and password registered with <token>secondref_acs</token>.

trans-unit.source: The code for this sample is located in the <ui>ASPNETSimpleService</ui> (C#\WebServices\ASPNETSimpleService) subdirectory of the <token>ad_acs_code_gallery</token> package.
trans-unit.target: The code for this sample is located in the <ui>ASPNETSimpleService</ui> (C#\WebServices\ASPNETSimpleService) subdirectory of the <token>ad_acs_code_gallery</token> package.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: To run this sample, you will need:
trans-unit.target: To run this sample, you will need:

trans-unit.source: To create an account at the Azure homepage and create an <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.
trans-unit.target: To create an account at the Azure homepage and create an <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.

trans-unit.source: <token>vs2010</token> (any version)
trans-unit.target: <token>vs2010</token> (any version)

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <externalLink><linkText>ACS Prerequisites</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=221065</linkUri></externalLink> (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=221065).
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <externalLink><linkText>ACS Prerequisites</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=221065</linkUri></externalLink> (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=221065).

trans-unit.source: Configuring the Sample
trans-unit.target: Configuring the Sample

trans-unit.source: The <token>secondref_acs</token> configuration required for this sample can be performed using either the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal or the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service.
trans-unit.target: The <token>secondref_acs</token> configuration required for this sample can be performed using either the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal or the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service.

trans-unit.source: This topic describes both options.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes both options.

trans-unit.source: Option 1: Configuring the Sample Using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Option 1: Configuring the Sample Using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal

trans-unit.source: Option 2: Configuring the Sample Using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service
trans-unit.target: Option 2: Configuring the Sample Using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service

trans-unit.source: Option 1: Configuring the Sample Using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Option 1: Configuring the Sample Using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal

trans-unit.source: To configure the sample using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal
trans-unit.target: To configure the sample using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal

trans-unit.source: This action opens the Access Control Service management portal.
trans-unit.target: This action opens the Access Control Service management portal.

trans-unit.source: To register your application with <token>secondref_acs</token>, click <ui>Relying party applications</ui>, click <ui>Add</ui>, and then enter the following information in the form:
trans-unit.target: To register your application with <token>secondref_acs</token>, click <ui>Relying party applications</ui>, click <ui>Add</ui>, and then enter the following information in the form:

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Name</ui> field, enter <ui>ASPNET Simple Service</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Name</ui> field, enter <ui>ASPNET Simple Service</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Realm</ui> field, enter <ui>http://localhost:8000/Service/</ui>
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Realm</ui> field, enter <ui>http://localhost:8000/Service/</ui>

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Return URL</ui> field, enter <ui>http://localhost:8000/Service/</ui>
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Return URL</ui> field, enter <ui>http://localhost:8000/Service/</ui>

trans-unit.source: Select <ui>SWT</ui> from the <ui>Token format</ui> drop-down list box.
trans-unit.target: Select <ui>SWT</ui> from the <ui>Token format</ui> drop-down list box.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Token Signing Key</ui> field, click <ui>Generate</ui> to create a token signing key.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Token Signing Key</ui> field, click <ui>Generate</ui> to create a token signing key.

trans-unit.source: Copy this key for use later in the configuration.
trans-unit.target: Copy this key for use later in the configuration.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Expiration Date</ui> field, enter an appropriate expiration date for the key.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Expiration Date</ui> field, enter an appropriate expiration date for the key.

trans-unit.source: The key will no longer be valid on this date
trans-unit.target: The key will no longer be valid on this date

trans-unit.source: Leave the other fields at their default values.
trans-unit.target: Leave the other fields at their default values.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Save</ui> and then click <ui>Home</ui> to return to the home page of the Access Control Service management portal.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Save</ui> and then click <ui>Home</ui> to return to the home page of the Access Control Service management portal.

trans-unit.source: With your relying party registered, it is now time to create the rules that determine the claims that <token>secondref_acs</token> will issue to your application.
trans-unit.target: With your relying party registered, it is now time to create the rules that determine the claims that <token>secondref_acs</token> will issue to your application.

trans-unit.source: In this sample, we will create a rule that grants any registered user name and password an <ui>action</ui> claim with a value of <ui>reverse</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In this sample, we will create a rule that grants any registered user name and password an <ui>action</ui> claim with a value of <ui>reverse</ui>.

trans-unit.source: To create this rule, click <ui>Home</ui> to return to the home page of the Access Control Service management portal, , click <ui>Rule Groups</ui>, and then click <ui>Default Rule Group for ASP.NET Simple Service</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To create this rule, click <ui>Home</ui> to return to the home page of the Access Control Service management portal, , click <ui>Rule Groups</ui>, and then click <ui>Default Rule Group for ASP.NET Simple Service</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Add a new rule with the following settings:
trans-unit.target: Add a new rule with the following settings:

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Claim issuer</ui> section, select <ui>Access Control Service</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Claim issuer</ui> section, select <ui>Access Control Service</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Input claim type</ui> section, select <ui>Any</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Input claim type</ui> section, select <ui>Any</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Input claim value</ui> section, select <ui>Any</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Input claim value</ui> section, select <ui>Any</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Output claim type</ui> section, select <ui>Enter type</ui> and type <ui>action</ui> in the field.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Output claim type</ui> section, select <ui>Enter type</ui> and type <ui>action</ui> in the field.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Output claim value</ui> section, select <ui>Enter value</ui> and type <ui>reverse</ui> in the field.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Output claim value</ui> section, select <ui>Enter value</ui> and type <ui>reverse</ui> in the field.

trans-unit.source: In contrast to the web site samples, this sample relies on credentials managed by <token>secondref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: In contrast to the web site samples, this sample relies on credentials managed by <token>secondref_acs</token>.

trans-unit.source: The last step in configuring <token>secondref_acs</token> is registering the user name and password for the client application to use.
trans-unit.target: The last step in configuring <token>secondref_acs</token> is registering the user name and password for the client application to use.

trans-unit.source: To configure a new user name and password, click <ui>Home</ui> to return to the home page of the Access Control Service management portal, click <ui>Service identities</ui>, click <ui>Add</ui>, and fill out the form.
trans-unit.target: To configure a new user name and password, click <ui>Home</ui> to return to the home page of the Access Control Service management portal, click <ui>Service identities</ui>, click <ui>Add</ui>, and fill out the form.

trans-unit.source: For this sample, use the user name <ui>acssample</ui>, the Credential Type <ui>Password</ui>, and the password <ui>pass@word1</ui>.
trans-unit.target: For this sample, use the user name <ui>acssample</ui>, the Credential Type <ui>Password</ui>, and the password <ui>pass@word1</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Save</ui> and then click <ui>Home</ui> to return to the home page of the Access Control Service management portal.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Save</ui> and then click <ui>Home</ui> to return to the home page of the Access Control Service management portal.

trans-unit.source: Option 2: Configuring the Sample Using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service
trans-unit.target: Option 2: Configuring the Sample Using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service

trans-unit.source: The <token>vs_current_short</token> sample solution has a console application called <ui>ConfigureSample</ui> which uses the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service and the common helpers defined in the Common class library.
trans-unit.target: The <token>vs_current_short</token> sample solution has a console application called <ui>ConfigureSample</ui> which uses the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service and the common helpers defined in the Common class library.

trans-unit.source: This application can be used to configure an <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> for use with this sample.
trans-unit.target: This application can be used to configure an <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> for use with this sample.

trans-unit.source: To configure the sample using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service
trans-unit.target: To configure the sample using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service

trans-unit.source: To configure the sample, open <ui>SamplesConfiguration.cs</ui> (acs\Management\ManagementService\Common).
trans-unit.target: To configure the sample, open <ui>SamplesConfiguration.cs</ui> (acs\Management\ManagementService\Common).

trans-unit.source: Replace the placeholders in the <system>SamplesConfiguration</system> class in the Common class library with information about your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.
trans-unit.target: Replace the placeholders in the <system>SamplesConfiguration</system> class in the Common class library with information about your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.

trans-unit.source: You can find the information in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: You can find the information in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: To navigate to the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal: <token>ad_acs_portal</token> <token>ad_acs_manage_namespace</token>
trans-unit.target: To navigate to the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal: <token>ad_acs_portal</token> <token>ad_acs_manage_namespace</token>

trans-unit.source: <ui>ServiceNamespace</ui> - Enter the name of your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.
trans-unit.target: <ui>ServiceNamespace</ui> - Enter the name of your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.

trans-unit.source: <ui>ManagementServiceIdentityName</ui> - Enter the name of an <token>secondref_acs</token> management service account.
trans-unit.target: <ui>ManagementServiceIdentityName</ui> - Enter the name of an <token>secondref_acs</token> management service account.

trans-unit.source: The default is <system>ManagementClient</system>.
trans-unit.target: The default is <system>ManagementClient</system>.

trans-unit.source: To find the management service account name, in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, click <ui>Management service</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To find the management service account name, in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, click <ui>Management service</ui>.

trans-unit.source: The accounts are listed by name under <ui>Management Service Accounts</ui>.
trans-unit.target: The accounts are listed by name under <ui>Management Service Accounts</ui>.

trans-unit.source: <ui>ManagementServiceIdentityKey</ui> - Enter the password for the management service account.
trans-unit.target: <ui>ManagementServiceIdentityKey</ui> - Enter the password for the management service account.

trans-unit.source: To find the management service account password, in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, click <ui>Management service</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To find the management service account password, in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, click <ui>Management service</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Click the name of a management service account, and then, under <ui>Credentials</ui>, click <ui>Password</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click the name of a management service account, and then, under <ui>Credentials</ui>, click <ui>Password</ui>.

trans-unit.source: The password appears in the <ui>Password</ui> field.
trans-unit.target: The password appears in the <ui>Password</ui> field.

trans-unit.source: To copy the password, click <ui>Show Password</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To copy the password, click <ui>Show Password</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Run the ConfigureSample application in <token>vs_current_short</token>.
trans-unit.target: Run the ConfigureSample application in <token>vs_current_short</token>.

trans-unit.source: This will configure <token>secondref_acs</token> to run this sample.
trans-unit.target: This will configure <token>secondref_acs</token> to run this sample.

trans-unit.source: When the <ui>ConfigureSample</ui> application completes, it will output the generated relying party signing key to the console.
trans-unit.target: When the <ui>ConfigureSample</ui> application completes, it will output the generated relying party signing key to the console.

trans-unit.source: Copy this key to the clipboard.
trans-unit.target: Copy this key to the clipboard.

trans-unit.source: Running the Sample
trans-unit.target: Running the Sample

trans-unit.source: To run the sample
trans-unit.target: To run the sample

trans-unit.source: Open the sample in <token>vs_current_short</token>.
trans-unit.target: Open the sample in <token>vs_current_short</token>.

trans-unit.source: The solution consists of two projects: <ui>Service</ui> and <ui>Client</ui>.
trans-unit.target: The solution consists of two projects: <ui>Service</ui> and <ui>Client</ui>.

trans-unit.source: If you have not already done so, enter your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> details in <ui>Common\SamplesConfiguration.cs</ui>.
trans-unit.target: If you have not already done so, enter your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> details in <ui>Common\SamplesConfiguration.cs</ui>.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see step 1 of <ui>Option 2: Configuring via the ACS Management Service</ui>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see step 1 of <ui>Option 2: Configuring via the ACS Management Service</ui>.

trans-unit.source: This file is also used by the Service and Client projects.
trans-unit.target: This file is also used by the Service and Client projects.

trans-unit.source: Open the <ui>web.config</ui> file in the Service project.
trans-unit.target: Open the <ui>web.config</ui> file in the Service project.

trans-unit.source: Enter your token signing key in the appropriate AppSettings elements.
trans-unit.target: Enter your token signing key in the appropriate AppSettings elements.

trans-unit.source: If you configured <token>secondref_acs</token> using the Management Service, this is the value that you copied to the clipboard.
trans-unit.target: If you configured <token>secondref_acs</token> using the Management Service, this is the value that you copied to the clipboard.

trans-unit.source: To obtain the token signing key, refer to the <ui>Certificates and Keys</ui> area of the portal.
trans-unit.target: To obtain the token signing key, refer to the <ui>Certificates and Keys</ui> area of the portal.

trans-unit.source: Below is a code snippet showing this area of the Service web.config file.
trans-unit.target: Below is a code snippet showing this area of the Service web.config file.

trans-unit.source: Open the <ui>app.config</ui> file in the Client project.
trans-unit.target: Open the <ui>app.config</ui> file in the Client project.

trans-unit.source: Enter your user name and password in the appropriate AppSettings elements.
trans-unit.target: Enter your user name and password in the appropriate AppSettings elements.

trans-unit.source: To obtain the user name and password you previously registered, refer to the <ui>Service Identities</ui> area of the portal.
trans-unit.target: To obtain the user name and password you previously registered, refer to the <ui>Service Identities</ui> area of the portal.

trans-unit.source: Below is a code snippet showing this area (properly updated) of the Client app.config file.
trans-unit.target: Below is a code snippet showing this area (properly updated) of the Client app.config file.

trans-unit.source: To run the sample, start the service and then start the client.
trans-unit.target: To run the sample, start the service and then start the client.

trans-unit.source: At the client, enter a string to reverse.
trans-unit.target: At the client, enter a string to reverse.

trans-unit.source: The client console window should then show output indicating that it has received a token from <token>secondref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: The client console window should then show output indicating that it has received a token from <token>secondref_acs</token>.
